title: Introduction to swisspalmR
text: purpose swisspalmR package make data SwissPalm, database protein S-palmitoylation accessible R users. achieved using httr2 mimic HTTP requests usually sent browser SwissPalm. Check vignette implementation details information.

title: Introduction to swisspalmR
text: SwissPalm data easily accessed web browsers, simple interface. Users may perform several actions: Use central text bar ‘Search’ button get palmitoylation data protein/gene names, separated commas Use ‘Batch search’ button upload file many gene identifiers Use ‘Palmitoyl-proteome comparison’ button perform check user’s protein/gene list published palmitoyl-proteomes variety species. header bar contains even options, can check : SwissPalm database excellent source information researchers interested S-palmitoylation, database made easily accessible R. swisspalmR package resolves making HTTP requests used SwissPalm website send retrieve S-palmitoylation data web browsers.

title: Introduction to swisspalmR
text: use swisspalmR, install package GitHub. present, swisspalmR one function, swissPalm(), can retrieve protein-level information S-palmitoylation usually accessible https://www.swisspalm.org/proteins. function returns 25-column data frame protein information (available) includes: organism queried gene/protein ID Whether protein/gene associated queried ID reviewed UniProt residues palmitoylation occurs number cysteine residues PATs/APTs palmitoylate/depalmitoylate queried protein information information swissPalm() useful determining pattern palmitoylation samples. get data S-palmitoylation irrespective factors, provide character vector protein identifiers swissPalm(). identifiers one formats dropdown menu : UniProt AC UniProt secondary AC UniProt ID UniProt gene name Ensembl protein Ensembl gene Refseq protein ID IPI ID UniGene ID PomBase ID MGI ID RGD ID TAIR protein ID EuPathDb ID Let’s say UniProt accession, UniProt ID, Ensembl ID. SwissPalm recognises , swissPalm() give information . single gene name (e.g. "CALML5") maps onto multiple proteins, proteins row. query identifiers found SwissPalm NA columns, Found_in_SwissPalm column tell found SwissPalm search:
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("simpar1471/swisspalmR") inputs <- c("Q4WCM2", "ENSP00000453745", "CALML5") # Include only first five columns to restrict printed output swissPalm(inputs)[, 1:5] #>   Query_identifier UniProt_AC   UniProt_ID UniProt_status #> 1  ENSP00000453745     P08912   ACM5_HUMAN       Reviewed #> 2           CALML5     Q9NZT1  CALL5_HUMAN       Reviewed #> 3           CALML5     E2RHU8 E2RHU8_CANLF     Unreviewed #> 4           CALML5     A4IFQ6 A4IFQ6_BOVIN     Unreviewed #> 5           Q4WCM2     Q4WCM2 Q4WCM2_ASPFU     Unreviewed #> 6           CALML5     F7HMI0 F7HMI0_MACMU     Unreviewed #> 7           CALML5     F6ZF46 F6ZF46_HORSE     Unreviewed #> 8           CALML5     G1T3Q4 G1T3Q4_RABIT     Unreviewed #> 9           CALML5     F1RYW2   F1RYW2_PIG     Unreviewed #>                                                        Organism #> 1                                                  Homo sapiens #> 2                                                  Homo sapiens #> 3                                              Canis familiaris #> 4                                                    Bos taurus #> 5 Neosartorya fumigata (strain CEA10 / CBS 144.89 / FGSC A1163) #> 6                                                Macaca mulatta #> 7                                                Equus caballus #> 8                                         Oryctolagus cuniculus #> 9                                                    Sus scrofa inputs <- c("Q4WCM2", "BAD_ID") swissPalm(inputs)[, 1:5] #>   Query_identifier UniProt_AC   UniProt_ID UniProt_status #> 1           Q4WCM2     Q4WCM2 Q4WCM2_ASPFU     Unreviewed #> 2           BAD_ID       <NA>         <NA>           <NA> #>                                                        Organism #> 1 Neosartorya fumigata (strain CEA10 / CBS 144.89 / FGSC A1163) #> 2                                                          <NA>

title: Introduction to swisspalmR
text: Sometimes, may want limit search space species checking, check data specific sources. species dataset parameters swissPalm() let . can check package objects swisspalmR::species swisspalmR::datasets see available species/dataset parameter values : example, gene name can shared many species. filter results SwissPalm search species interest, horses, telling swissPalm() want data: can also limit SwissPalm giving information proteins predicted S-palmitoylated using dataset parameter:
code: # There are 92 species available as of Sep 12th 2023 swisspalmR::species[1:5] #> All species in SwissPalm             Homo sapiens             Mus musculus  #>                       ""                      "1"                      "2"  #>        Rattus norvegicus Saccharomyces cerevisiae  #>                      "3"                      "6" # There are 7 datasets available as of Sep 12th 2023 swisspalmR::datasets #>                                                                                  Dataset 1: All proteins  #>                                                                                                    "all"  #>                                                        Dataset 2: Proteins predicted to be palmitoylated  #>                                                                                                   "pred"  #>      Dataset 3: Palmitoylation validated or found in at least 1 palmitoyl-proteome (SwissPalm annotated)  #>                                                                                                   "palm"  #>                                                             Dataset 4: Palmitoylation validated proteins  #>                                                                                                   "targ"  #> Dataset 5: Palmitoylation validated proteins or found in palmitoyl-proteomes using 2 independent methods  #>                                                                                                   "meth"  #>                                      Dataset 6: Found in palmitoyl-proteomes using 2 independent methods  #>                                                                                                  "meth2"  #>                                                                     Dataset 7: Dataset 6 grouped by gene  #>                                                                                      "validated_dataset" gene_names <- c("ADAMTS1", "AGL", "ANGPTL4", "CALML5", "CEP131", "CD70", "CD97") swissPalm(gene_names, species = swisspalmR::species["Equus caballus"])[, 1:5] #>   Query_identifier UniProt_AC   UniProt_ID UniProt_status       Organism #> 1              AGL     A8BQB4    GDE_HORSE       Reviewed Equus caballus #> 2             CD70     F6XHL7 F6XHL7_HORSE     Unreviewed Equus caballus #> 3           CALML5     F6ZF46 F6ZF46_HORSE     Unreviewed Equus caballus #> 4          ADAMTS1       <NA>         <NA>           <NA>           <NA> #> 5          ANGPTL4       <NA>         <NA>           <NA>           <NA> #> 6             CD97       <NA>         <NA>           <NA>           <NA> #> 7           CEP131       <NA>         <NA>           <NA>           <NA> gene_names <- c("ADAMTS1", "AGL", "ANGPTL4", "CALML5", "CEP131", "CD70", "CD97") swissPalm(   gene_names,   species = swisspalmR::species["Equus caballus"],   dataset = swisspalmR::datasets["Dataset 2: Proteins predicted to be palmitoylated"] )[, 1:5] #>   Query_identifier UniProt_AC   UniProt_ID UniProt_status       Organism #> 1              AGL     A8BQB4    GDE_HORSE       Reviewed Equus caballus #> 2             CD70     F6XHL7 F6XHL7_HORSE     Unreviewed Equus caballus #> 3          ADAMTS1       <NA>         <NA>           <NA>           <NA> #> 4          ANGPTL4       <NA>         <NA>           <NA>           <NA> #> 5           CALML5       <NA>         <NA>           <NA>           <NA> #> 6             CD97       <NA>         <NA>           <NA>           <NA> #> 7           CEP131       <NA>         <NA>           <NA>           <NA>

code: @Manual{,   title = {swisspalmR: Access SwissPalm data},   author = {Simon Parker},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/simpar1471/swisspalmR/, https://simpar1471.github.io/swisspalmR/}, }

title: Access SwissPalm data
text: swisspalmR small package one purpose: retrieval S-palmitoylation data SwissPalm database using httr2, rvest curl.

title: Access SwissPalm data
text: can install development version swisspalmR GitHub :

title: Access SwissPalm data
text: query SwissPalm database, get protein accessions vector. proteins must supported SwissPalm, .e. UniProt AC, UniProt secondary AC, UniProt ID, UniProt gene name, Ensembl protein, Ensembl gene, Refseq protein ID, IPI ID, UniGene ID, PomBase ID, MGI ID, RGD ID, TAIR protein ID, EuPathDb ID. vector can query SwissPalm database using swissPalm() function. ’ll receive 25-column dataframe rows query ID supplied function, detailing various aspects S-palmitoylation protein found SwissPalm. example: can test protein accessions specific datasets species SwissPalm using dataset species parameters. Valid values dataset species can found package objects swisspalmR::datasets swisspalmR::species. information using swissPalm() can found introductory vignette. Note swissPalm() memoised - results cached returned inputs provided swissPalm() one session. way, SwissPalm can return results users faster. want swissPalm() function ‘forget’ previous results, use memoise::forget(swissPalm).
code: protein_ids <- c("P05067", "O00161", "P04899", "P98019") # Only using 5 cols to restrict printed output swisspalmR::swissPalm(protein_ids)[, c(1, 3, 4, 23, 24)] #>   Query_identifier  UniProt_ID UniProt_status Protein_has_hits_in_SwissPalm #> 1           P05067    A4_HUMAN       Reviewed                          TRUE #> 2           P04899 GNAI2_HUMAN       Reviewed                          TRUE #> 3           O00161 SNP23_HUMAN       Reviewed                          TRUE #> 4           P98019  COX2_ANAPL       Reviewed                         FALSE #>   Orthologs_of_this_protein_have_hits_in_SwissPalm #> 1                                             TRUE #> 2                                             TRUE #> 3                                             TRUE #> 4                                            FALSE # Checking against only mallard ducks mallard <- swisspalmR::species["Mallard duck"] swisspalmR::swissPalm(protein_ids, species = mallard)[, c(1, 3, 4, 23, 24)] #>   Query_identifier UniProt_ID UniProt_status Protein_has_hits_in_SwissPalm #> 1           P98019 COX2_ANAPL       Reviewed                         FALSE #> 2           O00161       <NA>           <NA>                            NA #> 3           P04899       <NA>           <NA>                            NA #> 4           P05067       <NA>           <NA>                            NA #>   Orthologs_of_this_protein_have_hits_in_SwissPalm #> 1                                            FALSE #> 2                                               NA #> 3                                               NA #> 4                                               NA

title: Access SwissPalm data
text: Though swissPalm() memoised, function request data already received SwissPalm provided different vector, different species/dataset parameters used. calls, data “P05067” requested SwissPalm three times even though SwissPalm memoised. plan implement caching system separate memoise cache swissPalm() outputs memory. retrieved necessary reduce load SwissPalm database. Additionally, SwissPalm database just protein-level data accessed swissPalm(). includes data hits/sites experiments. plan extend swisspalmR accessing data.

title: Access SwissPalm data
text: SwissPalm database available Creative Commons -NC-ND license. SwissPalm reference: SwissPalm: Protein Palmitoylation database. Mathieu Blanc, Fabrice P.. David, Laurence Abrami, Daniel Migliozzi, Florence Armand, Jérôme Burgi F. Gisou van der Goot. F1000Research.

title: Retrieve palmitoylation data from the swissPalm database — swissPalm
Retrieve palmitoylation data from the swissPalm database — swissPalm
text: query_id Character vector protein identifiers. ID type supported SwissPalm (UniProt AC, UniProt secondary AC, UniProt ID, UniProt gene name, Ensembl protein, Ensembl gene, Refseq protein ID, IPI ID, UniGene ID, PomBase ID, MGI ID, RGD ID, TAIR protein ID, EuPathDb ID; SwissPalm website). dataset dataset use swissPalm. set "" value swisspalm::datasets. Default = "" (datasets). species species use swissPalm. set "" value swisspalm::species. Default = "" (species).

title: Retrieve palmitoylation data from the swissPalm database — swissPalm
text: Data frame palmitoylation data proteins protein_id, notes elements protein_id found SwissPalm.

title: swisspalmR 0.1.0
text: done downloading raw text file SwissPalm database, formatting read.table(). data frame returned swissPalm() now list-columns can multiple returned values, e.g. Sites_in_main_isoform column. Better (.e. actual) unit testing testthat. changed number imports thanks refactoring.
